alert.note: Alert for Charlotte (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following county, Charlotte. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 312 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen 200 PM. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Branch Wards Fork Creek, West Branch Wards Fork Creek, Dunnavant Creek, Wards Fork Creek, Austin Creek, Terrys Creek, Roanoke Creek, Middle Branch Wards Fork Creek, Flintoy Creek and Jenkins Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charlotte Court House... Cullen... Abilene... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
